slides.title: Welcome to Azure
slides.content:
# Microsoft Azure ‚òÅÔ∏è

Azure is Microsoft's cloud computing platform, offering 200+ services for building, deploying, and managing applications.

## What You'll Learn
- **Virtual Machines** - Scalable compute resources
- **Blob Storage** - Object storage for unstructured data
- **Azure Functions** - Serverless compute
- **SQL Database** - Managed SQL Server in the cloud

## Why Azure?
| Feature | Benefit |
|---------|--------|
| **Hybrid Ready** | Seamless on-prem integration |
| **Enterprise Focus** | Microsoft ecosystem integration |
| **Global Scale** | 60+ regions worldwide |
| **Compliance** | 90+ compliance certifications |

> üí° **Fun Fact:** Azure was launched in 2010 as "Windows Azure" and rebranded to "Microsoft Azure" in 2014!

slides.title: Azure Global Infrastructure
slides.content:
# Azure Regions & Availability üåç

Azure operates the largest global cloud infrastructure.

## Key Concepts

### Regions
- Geographic areas with data centers
- Examples: `East US`, `West Europe`, `Southeast Asia`
- Over 60 regions worldwide

### Availability Zones
- Physically separate locations within a region
- Independent power, cooling, networking
- 99.99% SLA for VMs

### Region Pairs
- Each region paired with another 300+ miles away
- Automatic replication for some services
- Priority recovery during outages

```
Azure Region (East US)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Availability Zone 1
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Availability Zone 2
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Availability Zone 3
        ‚îÇ
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Paired with: West US
```

## Resource Organization
```
Management Groups
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Subscriptions
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Resource Groups
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Resources (VMs, Storage, etc.)
```

slides.title: Azure Virtual Machines
slides.content:
# Azure Virtual Machines üñ•Ô∏è

On-demand, scalable computing resources in the cloud.

## What are Azure VMs?
- Windows or Linux virtual servers
- Full control over OS and software
- Pay-per-minute billing
- Flexible sizing options

## VM Series

| Series | Optimized For | Use Case |
|--------|--------------|----------|
| **B** | Burstable | Dev/test, low traffic |
| **D** | General purpose | Most workloads |
| **E** | Memory | Databases, caching |
| **F** | Compute | Batch, gaming |
| **N** | GPU | ML, rendering |

## Common Sizes
```
Standard_B1s  - 1 vCPU, 1 GB RAM (Budget)
Standard_D2s_v3 - 2 vCPU, 8 GB RAM (General)
Standard_E4s_v3 - 4 vCPU, 32 GB RAM (Memory)
Standard_F4s_v2 - 4 vCPU, 8 GB RAM (Compute)
```

> üí∞ **Free Tier:** 750 hours/month of B1s Windows or Linux VM for 12 months!

slides.title: Creating Azure VMs
slides.content:
# Creating Virtual Machines üöÄ

Multiple ways to create and manage VMs.

## Azure Portal Steps
1. Navigate to Virtual Machines
2. Click "Create" ‚Üí "Azure virtual machine"
3. Configure basics (name, region, image)
4. Select size
5. Configure networking
6. Review and create

## Azure CLI
```bash
# Create resource group
az group create --name myRG --location eastus

# Create VM
az vm create \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --name myVM \
  --image Ubuntu2204 \
  --size Standard_B1s \
  --admin-username azureuser \
  --generate-ssh-keys

# Open port 80
az vm open-port --port 80 --resource-group myRG --name myVM
```

## Connect to VM
```bash
# Linux (SSH)
ssh azureuser@<public-ip>

# Windows (RDP)
mstsc /v:<public-ip>
```

## PowerShell
```powershell
New-AzVM -ResourceGroupName "myRG" `
  -Name "myVM" `
  -Location "EastUS" `
  -Image "Win2019Datacenter" `
  -Size "Standard_D2s_v3"
```

slides.title: VM Availability Options
slides.content:
# High Availability for VMs üîÑ

Ensure your VMs are always running.

## Availability Sets
- Distribute VMs across fault domains
- Protect from hardware failures
- 99.95% SLA

```
Availability Set
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fault Domain 0
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VM1, VM3
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fault Domain 1
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VM2, VM4
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Update Domain (rolling updates)
```

## Availability Zones
- Physically separate data centers
- Each zone has independent infrastructure
- 99.99% SLA

## Scale Sets (VMSS)
- Auto-scaling groups of identical VMs
- Load balanced automatically
- Scale from 0 to 1000+ VMs

```bash
# Create scale set
az vmss create \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --name myScaleSet \
  --image Ubuntu2204 \
  --instance-count 3 \
  --upgrade-policy-mode automatic
```

## Comparison
| Feature | Availability Set | Availability Zone | Scale Set |
|---------|-----------------|--------------------|----------|
| Isolation | Rack-level | Data center | Either |
| Auto-scale | No | No | Yes |
| SLA | 99.95% | 99.99% | Depends |

slides.title: Azure Blob Storage Introduction
slides.content:
# Azure Blob Storage üì¶

Massively scalable object storage for unstructured data.

## What is Blob Storage?
- Store any type of data (images, videos, logs)
- Accessed via HTTP/HTTPS
- Unlimited capacity
- 11 9's durability (99.999999999%)

## Storage Hierarchy
```
Storage Account
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Container
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blob (file.jpg)
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blob (document.pdf)
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Virtual Directory/
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Blob (data.csv)
```

## Blob Types

| Type | Description | Use Case |
|------|-------------|----------|
| **Block Blob** | Text and binary data | Images, documents |
| **Append Blob** | Optimized for append | Log files |
| **Page Blob** | Random read/write | VHD disks |

## Access Tiers
- **Hot** - Frequently accessed (highest storage cost)
- **Cool** - Infrequently accessed (30-day minimum)
- **Cold** - Rarely accessed (90-day minimum)
- **Archive** - Offline storage (180-day minimum)

> üí° **Cost Tip:** Use lifecycle management to auto-tier blobs!

slides.title: Working with Blob Storage
slides.content:
# Blob Storage Operations üîß

Managing containers and blobs.

## Azure CLI Commands

```bash
# Create storage account
az storage account create \
  --name mystorageacct \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --sku Standard_LRS

# Create container
az storage container create \
  --name mycontainer \
  --account-name mystorageacct

# Upload blob
az storage blob upload \
  --container-name mycontainer \
  --file ./local-file.txt \
  --name remote-file.txt \
  --account-name mystorageacct

# Download blob
az storage blob download \
  --container-name mycontainer \
  --name remote-file.txt \
  --file ./downloaded.txt \
  --account-name mystorageacct

# List blobs
az storage blob list \
  --container-name mycontainer \
  --account-name mystorageacct
```

## Blob URLs
```
https://<account>.blob.core.windows.net/<container>/<blob>
https://mystorageacct.blob.core.windows.net/images/photo.jpg
```

## Shared Access Signatures (SAS)
```
?sv=2021-06-08&ss=b&srt=co&sp=r&se=2024-01-01&sig=...
```
Time-limited, permission-scoped access tokens.

slides.title: Blob Security & Access
slides.content:
# Blob Storage Security üîí

Securing your storage account and data.

## Authentication Methods

### 1. Access Keys
- Full access to storage account
- Two keys for rotation
- Use for admin operations

### 2. Shared Access Signatures (SAS)
```
Types:
- Account SAS: Access to multiple services
- Service SAS: Access to single service
- User Delegation SAS: Azure AD backed
```

### 3. Azure AD Authentication
- RBAC roles for fine-grained access
- No keys to manage
- Recommended approach

## RBAC Roles
| Role | Permissions |
|------|-------------|
| Storage Blob Data Owner | Full access |
| Storage Blob Data Contributor | Read/write/delete |
| Storage Blob Data Reader | Read only |

## Network Security
```
Firewall Rules:
- Allow specific IP addresses
- Allow virtual network subnets
- Private endpoints for private access
```

## Encryption
- **At rest:** Always encrypted (SSE)
- **In transit:** HTTPS enforced
- **Customer-managed keys:** Optional

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Best Practice:** Disable public access and use private endpoints for production!

slides.title: Azure Functions Introduction
slides.content:
# Azure Functions ‚ö°

Serverless compute that runs code on-demand.

## What are Azure Functions?
- Event-driven, serverless compute
- Pay only when code runs
- Auto-scaling built-in
- Supports multiple languages

## Supported Languages
- C#
- JavaScript/TypeScript
- Python
- Java
- PowerShell
- Custom handlers

## Hosting Plans

| Plan | Scaling | Max Timeout | Use Case |
|------|---------|-------------|----------|
| **Consumption** | Auto | 10 min | Variable load |
| **Premium** | Auto | Unlimited | Always warm |
| **Dedicated** | Manual | Unlimited | Existing App Service |

## Triggers & Bindings
```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê     ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê     ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   Trigger   ‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Azure Function‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ   Binding   ‚îÇ
‚îÇ (HTTP, Timer)‚îÇ     ‚îÇ  (Your Code)  ‚îÇ     ‚îÇ (Blob, Queue)‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Pricing (Consumption Plan)
- **Free:** 1M executions/month
- **Execution:** $0.20 per million

slides.title: Creating Azure Functions
Functions Triggers & Bindings
slides.content:
# Triggers & Bindings üîó

Connect functions to events and services.

## Common Triggers

### Timer Trigger
```json
{
  "schedule": "0 */5 * * * *"
}
```
```python
def main(timer: func.TimerRequest) -> None:
    logging.info('Timer function ran!')
```

### Blob Trigger
```python
def main(blob: func.InputStream):
    logging.info(f"Blob name: {blob.name}")
    logging.info(f"Blob size: {blob.length} bytes")
    content = blob.read()
```

### Queue Trigger
```python
def main(msg: func.QueueMessage) -> None:
    message = msg.get_body().decode('utf-8')
    logging.info(f"Queue message: {message}")
```

## Output Bindings

### Write to Blob
```python
def main(req: func.HttpRequest, 
         outputBlob: func.Out[str]) -> func.HttpResponse:
    outputBlob.set("Hello, World!")
    return func.HttpResponse("Blob created!")
```

### Write to Queue
```json
{
  "type": "queue",
  "direction": "out",
  "queueName": "myqueue"
}
```

> üí° **Bindings = Less boilerplate code!**

slides.title: Azure SQL Database Introduction
slides.content:
# Azure SQL Database üóÑÔ∏è

Fully managed SQL Server database in the cloud.

## What is Azure SQL?
- Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)
- Built on SQL Server engine
- Automatic updates and patching
- Built-in high availability

## Deployment Options

| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **Single Database** | Isolated database |
| **Elastic Pool** | Shared resources |
| **Managed Instance** | Full SQL Server |

## Service Tiers

### DTU-based
- **Basic:** 5 DTUs, dev/test
- **Standard:** 10-3000 DTUs
- **Premium:** High performance

### vCore-based
- **General Purpose:** Balanced
- **Business Critical:** High IOPS
- **Hyperscale:** Up to 100TB

## Key Features
- ‚úÖ 99.99% availability SLA
- ‚úÖ Geo-replication
- ‚úÖ Automatic backups (35 days)
- ‚úÖ Advanced threat protection
- ‚úÖ Automatic tuning

> üí° **When to use:** Modernizing SQL Server apps without managing infrastructure!

slides.title: Creating Azure SQL Database
slides.content:
# Setting Up Azure SQL üöÄ

Create and connect to Azure SQL Database.

## Azure CLI
```bash
# Create SQL server
az sql server create \
  --name myserver \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --location eastus \
  --admin-user sqladmin \
  --admin-password MyP@ssw0rd!

# Create database
az sql db create \
  --server myserver \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --name mydb \
  --service-objective S0

# Configure firewall
az sql server firewall-rule create \
  --server myserver \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --name AllowMyIP \
  --start-ip-address 123.123.123.123 \
  --end-ip-address 123.123.123.123
```

## Connection String
```
Server=tcp:myserver.database.windows.net,1433;
Database=mydb;
User ID=sqladmin;
Password=MyP@ssw0rd!;
Encrypt=true;
```

## Python Connection
```python
import pyodbc

conn = pyodbc.connect(
    'DRIVER={ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server};'
    'SERVER=myserver.database.windows.net;'
    'DATABASE=mydb;'
    'UID=sqladmin;'
    'PWD=MyP@ssw0rd!'
)
```

slides.title: SQL Database Security
slides.content:
# SQL Security Features üîê

Protecting your database.

## Authentication

### SQL Authentication
- Username/password
- Stored in database

### Azure AD Authentication
- Centralized identity
- MFA support
- Recommended approach

## Network Security

### Firewall Rules
```bash
# Allow Azure services
az sql server firewall-rule create \
  --name AllowAzure \
  --server myserver \
  --start-ip-address 0.0.0.0 \
  --end-ip-address 0.0.0.0
```

### Private Endpoints
- Access from VNet only
- No public internet exposure

## Data Protection

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **TDE** | Transparent Data Encryption (at rest) |
| **Always Encrypted** | Client-side encryption |
| **Dynamic Data Masking** | Hide sensitive data |
| **Row-Level Security** | Filter rows per user |

## Auditing
```json
{
  "auditActionsAndGroups": [
    "SUCCESSFUL_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP",
    "FAILED_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP"
  ]
}
```

slides.title: SQL High Availability
slides.content:
# High Availability & DR üîÑ

Ensure database uptime and data protection.

## Built-in HA

### Locally Redundant
```
Primary Replica ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ Secondary Replica 1
        ‚îÇ
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ Secondary Replica 2
```
- 3 replicas within data center
- Automatic failover
- Included in all tiers

## Geo-Replication

### Active Geo-Replication
- Up to 4 readable secondaries
- Any region
- Read offload and DR

```bash
az sql db replica create \
  --name mydb \
  --server myserver \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --partner-server myserver-dr \
  --partner-resource-group myRG-dr
```

### Auto-Failover Groups
- Automatic failover
- Single connection string
- RPO < 5 seconds

## Backup & Restore

| Backup Type | Frequency | Retention |
|-------------|-----------|----------|
| Full | Weekly | 7-35 days |
| Differential | Every 12h | Same |
| Transaction Log | Every 5-10 min | Same |

```bash
# Point-in-time restore
az sql db restore \
  --dest-name mydb-restored \
  --name mydb \
  --server myserver \
  --time "2024-01-15T10:00:00Z"
```

slides.title: Azure Resource Management
slides.content:
# Azure Resource Manager üìã

Manage and organize Azure resources.

## Resource Groups
- Logical containers for resources
- Same lifecycle management
- Apply policies and RBAC

```bash
# Create resource group
az group create --name myRG --location eastus

# List resources in group
az resource list --resource-group myRG

# Delete entire group
az group delete --name myRG
```

## Tags
```bash
# Add tags
az resource tag \
  --tags Environment=Production Department=IT \
  --id /subscriptions/.../resourceGroups/myRG
```

## ARM Templates
```json
{
  "$schema": "https://schema.management.azure.com/schemas/2019-04-01/deploymentTemplate.json#",
  "contentVersion": "1.0.0.0",
  "resources": [
    {
      "type": "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts",
      "apiVersion": "2021-09-01",
      "name": "mystorageacct",
      "location": "[resourceGroup().location]",
      "sku": {
        "name": "Standard_LRS"
      },
      "kind": "StorageV2"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Bicep (Modern IaC)
```bicep
resource storage 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts@2021-09-01' = {
  name: 'mystorageacct'
  location: resourceGroup().location
  sku: { name: 'Standard_LRS' }
  kind: 'StorageV2'
}
```

slides.title: Azure Identity & Access
slides.content:
# Azure Active Directory üîê

Identity and access management for Azure.

## Key Concepts

### Users & Groups
- Individual identities
- Security groups for access
- Dynamic membership rules

### App Registrations
- Register apps for Azure AD
- OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect
- Managed identities

### RBAC (Role-Based Access Control)
```

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§

‚îÇ Where (Scope)                       ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  - Management Group/Sub/RG/Resource ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Built-in Roles

| Role | Permissions |
|------|-------------|
| **Owner** | Full access + assign roles |

## Managed Identities


slides.title: Azure Networking
slides.content:
# Azure Virtual Network üåê

Isolated network infrastructure in Azure.

## VNet Components

### Virtual Network
```bash
az network vnet create \
  --name myVNet \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --address-prefixes 10.0.0.0/16
```

### Subnets
```bash
az network vnet subnet create \
  --name webSubnet \
  --vnet-name myVNet \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --address-prefixes 10.0.1.0/24
```

## Network Security Groups (NSG)
```bash
# Create NSG
az network nsg create --name myNSG --resource-group myRG

# Add rule
az network nsg rule create \
  --nsg-name myNSG \
  --name AllowHTTP \
  --priority 100 \
  --destination-port-ranges 80 \
  --access Allow
```

# Cost Management üí∞

Monitor and optimize Azure spending.

## Cost Management Tools

### Cost Analysis
- View spending by service, resource group, tag
- Filter and group costs
- Export to CSV

### Budgets
```
Budget: $500/month
Alert 1: 80% ‚Üí Email notification
Alert 2: 100% ‚Üí Email + Action Group
```

### Advisor Recommendations
- Right-size VMs
- Delete unused resources
- Reserved Instance suggestions

## Pricing Calculator
- Estimate costs before deployment
- Compare regions and tiers
- Create and save estimates

## Cost Saving Strategies

| Strategy | Potential Savings |
|----------|------------------|
| Reserved Instances | Up to 72% |
| Azure Hybrid Benefit | Up to 85% |
| Spot VMs | Up to 90% |
| Right-sizing | 20-30% |
| Auto-shutdown | Variable |

## Auto-shutdown
```bash
# Schedule VM shutdown
az vm auto-shutdown \
  --resource-group myRG \
  --name myVM \
  --time 1900 \
  --timezone "Pacific Standard Time"
```
